parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A faulty water pump can cause the engine to overheat, leading to major engine failure, damage to the radiator assembly, and potentially resulting in a "meltdown" of the engine.
A faulty thermostat can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage and potentially resulting in a "meltdown" of the engine.
Premature brake rotor failure can lead to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: Brake lights illuminate on the dashboard
brake rotors and pads need to be replaced prematurely.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the Anti-lock Braking System (ABS) can lead to loss of control, increased stopping distances, and potentially cause accidents.
symptoms: ABS brake light indicator illuminates on the dashboard

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake system failure can lead to reduced braking performance, increased stopping distances, and potentially cause accidents.

The failure of the cooling system can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, breakdowns, and potentially even engine failure, which can leave the driver stranded and pose a safety risk.
symptoms: the vehicle needs to be towed to a repair shop

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering system can cause loss of steering control, making it difficult or impossible to steer the vehicle, which can lead to accidents or loss of control.
symptoms: The steering wheel moves in and out repetitively
the steering wheel does not respond to input
the vehicle is difficult to steer
the steering system makes unusual noises.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause various components to malfunction, leading to inconvenience, distraction, and potentially even safety risks.
symptoms: The radio and CD player stop working
